name: Min Or Sum
statement: You are given an array $$$a$$$ of size $$$n$$$. You can perform the following operation on the array: Choose two different integers $$$i, j$$$ $$$(1 \leq i < j \leq n$$$), replace $$$a_i$$$ with $$$x$$$ and $$$a_j$$$ with $$$y$$$. In order not to break the array, $$$a_i | a_j = x | y$$$ must be held, where $$$|$$$ denotes the bitwise OR operation . Notice that $$$x$$$ and $$$y$$$ are non-negative integers. Please output the minimum sum of the array you can get after using the operation above any number of times.
inputFormat: Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases $$$t$$$ $$$(1 \leq t \leq 1000)$$$. Description of the test cases follows. The first line of each test case contains an integer $$$n$$$ $$$(2 \leq n \leq 100)$$$ — the size of array $$$a$$$. The second line of each test case contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \ldots ,a_n$$$ $$$(0 \leq a_i < 2^{30})$$$.
outputFormat: For each test case, print one number in a line — the minimum possible sum of the array.
